title: How to Make a Greeting Card Envelope

steps.headline: Lay your card on a piece of 8 1/2 x 11 paper.
steps.description: Center it horizontally on the paper but a little low. If you don't have a card already, just mark the paper where you want your card to be.

steps.headline: Fold the sides of the paper inwards.
steps.description: Leave a little room so the envelope will be a little larger than the card. Press firmly on the edge of each fold so it lays down flat.

steps.headline: Do the same with the top and the bottom (remembering to leave a little wiggle room).
Now flatten out the paper and remove the card.
Snip off the corners.
steps.description: Make a cut slightly larger than 90 degrees. One corner snipped off.

steps.headline: Do this for all four corners.
Check that the card will fit inside just nicely (always best to check this before you glue).
Put just a little dab of glue at the bottom of each side piece.
steps.description: Then fold the bottom up and press down (this glues the bottom piece on to the sides).

steps.headline: Measure and cut a new piece of paper slightly smaller than your envelope.
steps.description: This will be the back piece.

steps.headline: Glue carefully along the sides and bottom of the envelope, then place the back piece on and press down gently.
There you have it - the finished envelope!
steps.description: Put the card inside, then glue the top of the envelope closed.

tyn: Rubber glue - Elmers sell a good size bottle for around $6 including a handy brush inside the cap.
Brush (if one is not included with the glue)
Plain old 20# paper (almost any will do, but lighter paper is easier to handle)
